alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Northern Craven; Pamlico; Southern Craven (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 12:15PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Craven, southern Beaufort and northern Pamlico Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Edward, or 13 miles southeast of River Road, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Bern, Ransomville, Blounts Creek, Pamlico Beach, Askins, Cayton, Lowland, Wilmar, Edward, Royal, Cox Crossroads, Bonnerton, Core Point, South Creek, Bayview, Sidney Crossroads, Yeatesville, Ernul, Aurora Ferry Terminal, and Goose Creek State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Beaufort; Northern Craven; Pamlico; Southern Craven
